org.apache.ambari.server.orm.dao

Class AlertsDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ambari.server.orm.dao.AlertsDAO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cleanable

    public class AlertsDAO
extends Object
implements Cleanable
    The AlertsDAO class manages the AlertHistoryEntity and AlertCurrentEntity instances. Each AlertHistoryEntity is known as an "alert" that has been triggered and received.

    If alert caching is enabled, then updates to AlertCurrentEntity are not immediately persisted to JPA. Instead, they are kept in a cache and periodically flushed. This means that many queries will need to swap in the cached AlertCurrentEntity with that returned from the EclipseLink JPA entity manager.

        public List<AlertHistoryEntity> findAll()

        Returns:
        all alerts or an empty list if none exist (never null).

      • findAll

        public List<AlertHistoryEntity> findAll(long clusterId)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • findAll

        public List<AlertHistoryEntity> findAll(long clusterId,
                                        List<AlertState> alertStates)
        Gets all alerts stored in the database for the given cluster that have one of the specified alert states.
        Parameters:
        clusterId - the ID of the cluster.
        alertStates - the states to match for the retrieved alerts (not null).
        Returns:
        the alerts matching the specified states and cluster, or an empty list if none.

      • findAll

        public List<AlertHistoryEntity> findAll(long clusterId,
                                        Date startDate,
                                        Date endDate)
        Gets all alerts stored in the database for the given cluster and that fall withing the specified date range. Dates are expected to be in milliseconds since the epoch, normalized to UTC time.
        Parameters:
        clusterId - the ID of the cluster.
        startDate - the date that the earliest entry must occur after, normalized to UTC, or null for all entries that occur before the given end date.
        endDate - the date that the latest entry must occur before, normalized to UTC, or null for all entries that occur after the given start date.
        Returns:
        the alerts matching the specified date range.

        Finds all AlertHistoryEntity that match the provided AlertHistoryRequest. This method will make JPA do the heavy lifting of providing a slice of the result set.
        Parameters:
        request -
        Returns:

      • findCurrentCounts

        public AlertSummaryDTO findCurrentCounts(long clusterId,
                                         String serviceName,
                                         String hostName)
        Retrieves the summary information for a particular scope. The result is a DTO since the columns are aggregated and don't fit to an entity.
        Parameters:
        clusterId - the cluster id
        serviceName - the service name. Use null to not filter on service.
        hostName - the host name. Use null to not filter on host.
        Returns:
        the summary DTO

      • findCurrentPerHostCounts

        public Map<String,AlertSummaryDTO> findCurrentPerHostCounts(long clusterId)
        Retrieves the summary information for all the hosts in the provided cluster. The result is mapping from hostname to summary DTO.
        Parameters:
        clusterId - the cluster id
        Returns:
        map from hostnames to summary DTO

      • findCurrentHostCounts

        public AlertHostSummaryDTO findCurrentHostCounts(long clusterId)
        Retrieve the summary alert information for all hosts. This is different from findCurrentCounts(long, String, String) since this will return only alerts related to hosts and those values will be the total number of hosts affected, not the total number of alerts.
        Parameters:
        clusterId - the cluster id
        Returns:
        the summary DTO for host alerts.

      • findCurrentByService

        public List<AlertCurrentEntity> findCurrentByService(long clusterId,
                                                     String serviceName)
        Gets the current alerts for a given service.
        Returns:
        the current alerts for the given service or an empty list if none exist (never null).

      • findCurrentByHostAndName

        public AlertCurrentEntity findCurrentByHostAndName(long clusterId,
                                                   String hostName,
                                                   String alertName)
        Locate the current alert for the provided service and alert name. This method will first consult the cache if configured with Configuration.isAlertCacheEnabled().
        Parameters:
        clusterId - the cluster id
        hostName - the name of the host (not null).
        alertName - the name of the alert (not null).
        Returns:
        the current record, or null if not found

      • removeByDefinitionId

        public void removeByDefinitionId(long definitionId)
        Removes alert history and current alerts for the specified alert defintiion ID. This will invoke EntityManager.clear() when completed since the JPQL statement will remove entries without going through the EM.
        Parameters:
        definitionId - the ID of the definition to remove.

      • removeCurrentByHistoryId

        public int removeCurrentByHistoryId(long historyId)
        Remove a current alert whose history entry matches the specfied ID.
        Parameters:
        historyId - the ID of the history entry.
        Returns:
        the number of alerts removed.

      • removeCurrentDisabledAlerts

        public int removeCurrentDisabledAlerts()
        Remove all current alerts that are disabled.
        Returns:
        the number of alerts removed.

      • removeCurrentByService

        public int removeCurrentByService(long clusterId,
                                  String serviceName)
        Remove the current alert that matches the given service. This is used in cases where the service was removed from the cluster.

        This method will also fire an AggregateAlertRecalculateEvent in order to recalculate all aggregates.

        Parameters:
        clusterId - the ID of the cluster.
        serviceName - the name of the service that the current alerts are being removed for (not null).
        Returns:
        the number of alerts removed.

      • removeCurrentByHost

        public int removeCurrentByHost(String hostName)
        Remove the current alert that matches the given host. This is used in cases where the host was removed from the cluster.

        This method will also fire an AggregateAlertRecalculateEvent in order to recalculate all aggregates.

        Parameters:
        hostName - the name of the host that the current alerts are being removed for (not null).
        Returns:
        the number of alerts removed.

      • removeCurrentByServiceComponentHost

        public int removeCurrentByServiceComponentHost(long clusterId,
                                               String serviceName,
                                               String componentName,
                                               String hostName)
        Remove the current alert that matches the given service, component and host. This is used in cases where the component was removed from the host.

        This method will also fire an AggregateAlertRecalculateEvent in order to recalculate all aggregates.

        Parameters:
        clusterId - the ID of the cluster.
        serviceName - the name of the service that the current alerts are being removed for (not null).
        componentName - the name of the component that the current alerts are being removed for (not null).
        hostName - the name of the host that the current alerts are being removed for (not null).
        Returns:
        the number of alerts removed.

        Returns:
        the updated current alert with merged content (never null).

      • merge

        public AlertCurrentEntity merge(AlertCurrentEntity alert,
                                boolean updateCacheOnly)
        Updates the internal cache of alerts with the specified alert. Unlike merge(AlertCurrentEntity), this is not transactional and only updates the cache.

        The alert should already exist in JPA - this is mainly to update the text and timestamp.

        Parameters:
        alert - the alert to update in the cache (not null).
        updateCacheOnly - if true, then only the cache is updated and not JPA.
        See Also:
        Configuration.isAlertCacheEnabled()

      • remove

        public void remove(AlertCurrentEntity alert)
        Removes the specified current alert from the database.
        Parameters:
        alert - the current alert to remove.

      • findAggregateCounts

        public AlertSummaryDTO findAggregateCounts(long clusterId,
                                           String alertName)
        Finds the aggregate counts for an alert name, across all hosts.
        Parameters:
        clusterId - the cluster id
        alertName - the name of the alert to find the aggregate
        Returns:
        the summary data

      • findCurrentByNameNoHost

        public AlertCurrentEntity findCurrentByNameNoHost(long clusterId,
                                                  String alertName)
        Locate the current alert for the provided service and alert name, but when host is not set (IS NULL). This method will first consult the cache if configured with Configuration.isAlertCacheEnabled().
        Parameters:
        clusterId - the cluster id
        alertName - the name of the alert
        Returns:
        the current record, or null if not found

      • flushCachedEntitiesToJPA

        public void flushCachedEntitiesToJPA()
        Writes all cached AlertCurrentEntity instances to the database and clears the cache.
